intro: Pterocephalus brevis, commonly known as the short-headed pterocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces seed pods that are typically woody and contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots that help it access groundwater. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
